page.title: 02 SOUTH-AYR ALLOWAY
page.content: The Alloway, Doonfoot and Seafield zones of Ayr, close to the countryside, are mainly residential. Housing is mostly private and detached. Many inhabitants commute to Irvine, Kilmarnock and Glasgow. The River Doon meanders down to the sea where the thriving Ayr Bay Sailing Club is situated. Tourists throng to Burns' Cottage and to the Auld Kirk of "Tam o'Shanter" fame. The Land o' Burns' Centre gives information about the Burns' Heritage Trail.It is a high amenity area with fine recreational facilities. At Seafield and Belleisle there are 18 hole golf courses and at Cambusdoon we find Ayr Cricket and Hockey clubs. Within Rozelle Park is the Maclaurin Art Gallery. Adjacent to the busy public library is Alloway Primary School with over 400 pupils.
